Small demo of the MR.rr package

Yuexiang Peng, Zhilong Zhang

2024-11-19

MR.rr.Rmd

This is a demo vignette for our package. We will generate 2-dimensional data that is a mixture of 3 Gaussians, and then use an EM algorithm to estimate a clustering of the data.

The following lines of code runs the entire example (simulating the data, running the EM algorithm, and computing the probabilities that each sample is drawn from each Gaussian cluster).

library(MR.rr)
set.seed(123)

sim_result = run_simulation(regularized = TRUE, regularization_rate = 1e-13)
result_AB_list = sim_result[[1]]
result_AB_d_list = sim_result[[2]]
str(result_AB_list)
#> List of 5
#>  $ 1   : num [1:240, 1:100] -0.306 -0.484 -0.363 -0.956 -0.666 ...
#>  $ 0.5 : num [1:240, 1:100] 0.2862 0.0387 0.0183 -0.084 0.2477 ...
#>  $ 0.2 : num [1:240, 1:100] -0.1484 -0.4429 -0.0831 -0.0357 -0.103 ...
#>  $ 0.1 : num [1:240, 1:100] 0.2835 0.4905 -0.1222 0.2139 -0.0222 ...
#>  $ 0.05: num [1:240, 1:100] -0.152 0.282 -0.214 0.189 0.289 ...
summary(unlist(result_AB_list))
#>       Min.    1st Qu.     Median       Mean    3rd Qu.       Max. 
#> -11.359299  -0.243075  -0.001497   0.008942   0.249032  13.449512
summary(unlist(result_AB_d_list))
#>       Min.    1st Qu.     Median       Mean    3rd Qu.       Max. 
#> -14.409892  -0.165789   0.000838   0.001587   0.171261  12.509527
